SafetyInspectionBy: ND Dept. Of Ag; Fertilizer Division

_prev_prog_2.CH_OtherChanges: updated inspections, training and reviewed dates
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Emergency shutoff's, check hose and valves for dates
_prev_prog_2.Description:
The Accidental Release and Prevention Program Policy at Ever Green Cooperative.



Ever Green Co-op's policy is to make sure that those who handle NH3 are employees who have been trained in how to properly handle NH3. Use and maintain the proper safety equipment. Such as: Gloves, Goggles, Gas Masks, Rain Suits and etc. Employees that handle NH3 are required to attend an Annual Training Meeting that is performed by an outside Professional, experienced in NH3. The Emergency Responder's numbers are displayed in a highly visible area so that customers and employees can easily spot them. Some additional safety practices include: 1) Removing keys from the ignition and unhooking the nurse tank from the vehicle before filling nurse tanks. This insures no "drive off" with hoses hooked to the nurse tanks. 2) We have installed Tri Pods on all load out hoses. Tri Pods are NH3 approved couplers that are designed to snap apart when someone pulls away with hoses hooked up. This eliminates structure damage, broken hoses or pipes in event that someone pulls away when the hoses are still hooked up. in the future Ever Green will increase the inspections of all nurse tanks, customer and Co-op owned to make sure they ALL meet safety requirements.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies at Ever Green Co-op



Ever Green Co-op's policy is to make sure that those who handle NH3 are employees who have been trained in how to properly handle NH3, and maintain the proper safety equipment.  Such as:  (Gloves, Goggles, Gas Masks, Rain Suits, etc.)    Employees that handle NH3 are required to attend an Annual Training Meeting that is performed by an outside Professional experienced in NH3.  The Emergency Responder #'s are displayed in a highly visible area so that customers and employee's can easily spot them.    Some additional safety practices include:  1) Removing key from the ignition and unhooking the nurse tank from the vehicle before filling nurse tanks. This insures no "drive off" with hoses hooked up.  2) We have installed Tri Pods on all  load out hoses.  Tri-Pods are NH3 approved couple's that are designed to snap apart when someone pulls away with hoses hooked up.  This eliminates structure damage, broken hoses or pipes in event that someone pulls away when the hoses are still hooked up. We have installed concrete barriers around exposed piping for added protection. 



Our Facility and the Regulated Substances Handled



Ever Green Co-op's is a Farmer Owned Cooperative.  Located on a Farm NW of Tower City, ND.  We buy and sell fertilizer, seed, chemical and offer custom application of fertilizer and chemical. 

The regulated kind and quantity of fertilizer we handle consist of:  



     1)  Liquid fertilizer  500 tons 



     2)  NH3  2000 tons 



     3)  Dry Fertilizer  3800 tons 



     4)  Micro Nutrients  200 tons



Five Year Accident History



We have had no accident or accidental releases in the past five years



The Emergency Response Program



Annually we send our Tier II reports to our two local Fire Departments  Tower City, ND Fire Dept., and Valley City, ND Fire Dept.  In this report is a map of our facility along with the phone numbers of the Managers and/

or the people in charge.  This report also includes a list of hazardous materials stored at this facility.   We also held and documented a Public Notification Meeting.  Topics covered at our Public Notification Meeting were:

     A?  Properties of NH3

     A?  Safety Procedure you should do during a NH3 release

     A?  Demonstrated some safety equipment

     A?  Discussed offsite consequences

     A?  Concluded with a guest speaker from our Local Drug Enforcement Department



Planned Changes to Improve Safety at Ever Green Co-op



     A?  Increase the Training to twice a year instead of once a year



     A?  Closer Planned Inspections of Nurse Tanks in order to prevent theft of NH3 tanks



     A?  Continue to document all Maintenance & Inspections



     A?  Daily Inspection for Terrorism, Vandalism, or Drug Dealers/Users Activity
